from PIL import Image
# Try to open the AVIF file directly - newer Pillow versions support AVIF natively
try:
    img = Image.open\(''D:/Work/Sources/github/bannerlord/bn faces/FaceLearner.ML/Datasets/testing/photo-1438761681033-6461ffad8d80.jpg''\)
    print\(f''Format: {img.format}, Size: {img.size}, Mode: {img.mode}''\)
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''Failed: {e}''\)
    
# Check Pillow version
import PIL
print\(f''Pillow version: {PIL.__version__}''\)
# List supported formats
print\(f''AVIF support: {""AVIF"" in Image.registered_extensions\(\).values\(\)}''\)
")

Bash("/c/Program Files/AILocal/python/3.10/python.exe" -c "
import os
from PIL import Image

test_dir = ''D:/Work/Sources/github/bannerlord/bn faces/FaceLearner.ML/Datasets/testing''
converted = 0
skipped = 0

for fname in sorted\(os.listdir\(test_dir\)\):
    if not fname.endswith\(''.jpg''\):
        continue
    fpath = os.path.join\(test_dir, fname\)
    
    try:
        img = Image.open\(fpath\)
        if img.format == ''AVIF'':
            # Convert to RGB if needed \(AVIF can have alpha\)
            if img.mode != ''RGB'':
                img = img.convert\(''RGB''\)
            # Save as actual JPEG, overwriting
            img.save\(fpath, ''JPEG'', quality=95\)
            print\(f''  Converted: {fname} \({img.size[0]}x{img.size[1]}\)''\)
            converted += 1
        else:
            skipped += 1
    except Exception as e:
        print\(f''  ERROR: {fname}: {e}''\)

print\(f''Done: {converted} converted, {skipped} already JPEG''\)
")
